messages.content: Don't make assumptions about what values to plug into functions. Ask for clarification if a user request is ambiguous.
How far am I from the Golden Gate Bridge
To work out the distance, I’ll need to know your current location. Could you please share your latitude and longitude (or at least the city or address you’re starting from)?
I don't have that info right now.

No problem. To work out the distance I’ll still need some idea of where you are—anything from a street address or zip code to latitude/longitude coordinates will do. If you’re not sure how to get those details, here are a few quick options:

• Phone: Most smartphones show your current coordinates in their compass, maps, or emergency-call settings.  
• Web browser: Open Google Maps, right-click (or long-press) your blue location dot, and choose “What’s here?”—your latitude/longitude appear at the bottom.  
• Approximate location: Even just naming your city or a nearby landmark lets me give you an approximate distance.

Once you have any of that information, just share it here and I can calculate how far you are from the Golden Gate Bridge.
Could you use available tools to find out yourself?

I’m afraid I don’t have any way to detect your current location automatically. To calculate the distance, I still need at least an approximate starting point—anything from a street address or ZIP code to city name or latitude/longitude coordinates. Once you can provide that, I’ll be happy to work out how far you are from the Golden Gate Bridge.
I understand. Please turn on location services or any other needed services to find it.

I’m sorry, but I don’t have the capability to turn on or access location services on your device. If you can share even an approximate location—such as your city, ZIP code, or latitude/longitude—I can calculate the distance to the Golden Gate Bridge for you.
In this case, let's end the task here.
Understood—feel free to return anytime if you’d like help with this or anything else. Have a great day!
